conclusion: Consider forces acting on the system to determine frictional force on board ab.
Wooden block P slides on board ab, both experience frictional forces.
Frictional force on block P is f_P = μ2 * m * g.
Board ab experiences frictional forces from block P and ground.
Normal force on board ab is N = (m + M) * g.
Frictional force by ground on board ab is f_ground = μ1 * N = μ1 * (m + M) * g.
Final answer: f_ground = μ1 * (m + M) * g.
